Package entities

Class BackPack

java.lang.Object
entities.BackPack
public class BackPack
extends java.lang.Object
The BackPack class represents a container for storing MediKit items with a fixed maximum capacity. It provides functionality for adding, removing, and managing MediKit objects in a stack-based structure, ensuring that the specified maximum capacity is not exceeded.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    BackPack​(int maxCapacity)
    Constructs a BackPack with the specified maximum capacity.

  • Constructor Details

    • BackPack

      public BackPack​(int maxCapacity)
      Constructs a BackPack with the specified maximum capacity.
      Parameters:
      maxCapacity - the maximum number of items the backpack can hold

  • Method Details

    • addKit

      public void addKit​(MediKit kit)
      Adds a MediKit to the backpack. If the backpack is already at its maximum capacity, the method will display a message indicating that no more kits can be added and will not perform the addition.
      Parameters:
      kit - the MediKit to be added to the backpack

    • useKit

      public MediKit useKit() throws EmptyCollectionException
      Removes and returns the top MediKit from the backpack. This method allows a player to use a MediKit for restoring health. If the backpack is empty, an EmptyCollectionException is thrown to indicate the operation cannot proceed.
      Returns:
      the top MediKit from the backpack
      Throws:
      EmptyCollectionException - if the backpack is empty and no MediKit is available

    • isBackPackEmpty

      public boolean isBackPackEmpty()
      Checks if the backpack is empty.
      Returns:
      true if the backpack is empty, false otherwise

    • numberOfKits

      public int numberOfKits()
      Retrieves the total number of MediKit objects currently stored in the backpack.
      Returns:
      the number of MediKit objects in the backpack as an integer

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the BackPack object. The representation includes the list of items currently stored in the backpack.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of the BackPack and its contents.

    • getListItems

      public ArrayStack<MediKit> getListItems()
      Retrieves the current stack of MediKit objects stored in the backpack.
      Returns:
      an ArrayStack containing all MediKit objects currently in the backpack

    • isBackPackFull

      public boolean isBackPackFull()
      Checks if the backpack is at its maximum capacity.
      Returns:
      true if the backpack contains the maximum number of items it can hold, false otherwise.

    • getMaxCapacity

      public int getMaxCapacity()
      Retrieves the maximum capacity of the backpack.
      Returns:
      the maximum number of items the backpack can hold as an integer.
